tags.name: API Reference
tags.description: ## üìö [Documentation](https://api-doc.qonto.com/docs/business-api/6434cbb9d968d-qonto) ## üîì Authentication set up in Postman ### OAuth 2.0 1. Fill the "OAuth 2.0 variables" of the selected environment (Sandbox or Production) and save. 2\. To authenticate, you should **generate an access token**: - either by using the OAuth endpoints (cf. ["OAuth 2.0" folder](https://www.postman.com/qontoteam/workspace/qonto-public-api/folder/17790107-080f7311-97e9-44cb-82c7-1460ebb7708b?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=33800365&ctx=documentation)); - either by clicking on the "Get New Access Token" button available in the "Authorization" tab above. ## **API key** 1. Fill the "API key variables" of the selected environment (Sandbox or Production) and save. 2\. Select "No Auth" in the "Authorization" tab above and save. 3\. Activate the "Authorization" header in the requests.

tags.name: API Reference > Transactions > Attachments in Transactions

post.summary: Create an external transfer with trusted beneficiary

parameters.name: X-Qonto-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: (Required) This parameter is required. The API supports idempotency for safely retrying requests without accidentally performing the same operation twice. The idempotency key must be a unique string. We recommend using a UUID.

post.summary: Create external transfers with beneficiary data with SCA header

parameters.name: X-Qonto-2fa-Preference
parameters.description: If no header is present, the default becomes paired-device

parameters.name: X-Qonto-Staging-Token
parameters.description: Required only for Sandbox API requests; to get one, please submit the following form: https://getqonto.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/5/group/47/create/143.

parameters.name: include_external_accounts
parameters.description: By default includes only Qonto accounts. Set to 'true' if you also want to include your [connected externals account(s)](https://help.qonto.com/en/articles/9203596-how-to-connect-my-external-accounts-to-my-qonto-interface).

parameters.name: bank_account_id
parameters.description: The `id` of the bank account for which transactions will be retrieved. Use [/v2/organization](openapi_v2.yml/paths/~1v2~1organization/get) to get this parameter. If both `bank_account_id` and `iban` are specified, `bank_account_id` takes precedence.

parameters.name: bank_account_ids[]
parameters.description:
Statements can be filtered by their `bank_account_id`.
‚ö†Ô∏è `ibans` and `bank_account_ids` are mutually exclusive and cannot be used together.

parameters.name: ibans[]
parameters.description:
Statements can be filtered by their `iban`.
‚ö†Ô∏è `ibans` and `bank_account_ids` are mutually exclusive and cannot be used together.

parameters.name: period_from
parameters.description: Statements can be filtered by their `period`. This filter is the beginning of the desired statement period (included).

parameters.name: period_to
parameters.description: Statements can be filtered by their `period`. This filter is the end of the desired statement period (included).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: cf. https://api-doc.qonto.com/docs/business-api/05ccf93502e54-pagination

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: cf. https://api-doc.qonto.com/docs/business-api/05ccf93502e54-pagination

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Statements can be sorted by their `period` in 2 possible directions: `asc` (Ascending) / `desc` (Descending).
